https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: An interdisciplinary scientific field studying the influence of natural geological factors on human and animal health. Broadly, medical geology studies exposure to or deficiency of trace elements and minerals (the distribution of trace elements as related to nutrition, or the geographic patterns of disease); inhalation of ambient and anthropogenic mineral dusts and volcanic emissions; transportation, modification and concentration of organic compounds; the occurrence of toxic elements in unusual quantities in parts of the Earth's crust; and exposure to radionuclides, microbes and pathogens.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition adapted from Wikipedia and Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf, 2011).
